page.title: 03FARMING 2.
page.content: The farms in the area have managed to maintain their identities with their field layout unchanged for centuries. Manufactured fertilizers brought major changes to the modified 3-field system used over the years. Less reliant on natural fertilizers the less profitable dairy herd and other livestock were the first to go and the land was turned over to more marketable produce - vegetables and grain. Much of this produce was directed at the large food factories in Wigan and on Merseyside. In addition the E.E.C. and Government Subsidies changed trends and new crops have been introduced e.g. sugar beet and rape seed. The only animal stock now to be seen are cattle being fattened up for the meat market. Thus the farmers have made their farms very efficient and profitable.
